alert.note: Alert for Clay; Quitman; Randolph (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 05 at 1:33PM EDT until April 05 at 2:30PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Clay County in southwestern Georgia... Northwestern Randolph County in southwestern Georgia... Quitman County in southwestern Georgia... * Until 230 PM EDT. * At 132 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles north of Lakepoint Resort State Park to near Gaino, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Fort Gaines, Georgetown, Days Crossroads, Springvale Station, Wire Bridge, Walter F George Lake, Bonapartes Retreat, Standleys Store, Watson Crossroads, Moores Crossroads, Crossroads, Ricks Place, Garnersville, Bagby State Park, Hatcher, Morris, Springvale and Cotton Hill. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 PM EDT for southeastern Alabama. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for southwestern Georgia. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 PM EDT for southeastern Alabama. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for southwestern Georgia.
